text: Enea Bortolotti (28 September 1896 – 22 June 1942) was an Italian mathematician born in Rome. ==Biography== He graduated in mathematics in 1920 at the Universities of Pisa, where he was a student of Luigi Bianchi. He taught analytic and descriptive geometry at the Universities of Cagliari and Florence. He was mainly involved in differential geometry: it was a specialist in the theory of linear connections.An Italian short biography of Enea Bortolotti in MATEpristem online. ==Notes== ==External links== *An Italian short biography of Enea Bortolotti in MATEpristem online.
